About.Name: Thomas Robertson
About.AboutText:
Hi, I am Thomas Robertson. I am a computer science student with an interest in software development and programming. I am pursuing a bachelor of arts at Seattle Pacific University. I am expanding my knowledge and skills in a variety of areas of computer science.

I enjoy examining new ways to code and I prefer to work in well-managed collaborative environments.

Outside of class, I spend most of my time reading whatever is at hand. I believe that learning new things is a critical part of life, and try to do so when I have the time.

Experience.EducationText: I started SPU in fall 2023, and have been enjoying it so far.
Experience.EmploymentText: I am presently a full-time student
Experience.SkillsText:
I've studied a variety of concepts in programming, in a variety of languages. I am decently well-versed in both the practical and theoretical sides of Computer Science.

I recently completed the Microsoft Azure Developer Associate certification, and so have knowledge of how to deploy web apps to that platform.

Project1.Title: Big Data Graph Traversal
Project1.Desc: An early team project for a class, we created a node traversal for one of Google's big data sets. Implemented rather naively, it does do the job it was meant to do... albeit with some inefficencies. I was the primary contributor to this project.

Project2.Title: Seekr
Project2.Desc: My in-progress Senior Capstone project, an app by team Whitespace that helps with job applications. I am presently a developer of this project.
